titles.title: Secure Identity Protection Act
To direct the President to assess the advisability of requiring each State to use the Death Master File of the Social Security Administration in issuing drivers' licenses to individuals.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Social Security.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

bill.summary: 7/16/2003--Introduced. Secure Identity Protection Act - Directs the President to assess and report to Congress on the advisability of requiring each State to use the Death Master File of the Social Security Administration in issuing drivers' licenses to individuals as a method of determining the validity of the social security numbers supplied by them.
